jnxBgpM2.name: jnxBgpM2

revisions.description: This change redefines the value returned for the -- *** JNX *** variable jnxBgpM2PrefixesInPrefixesRejected so that -- *** JNX *** it conforms to the definition. -- *** JNX *** It also adds a new counter in the same sequence to -- *** JNX *** return the number of active prefixes received from -- *** JNX *** the peer: jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesActive

This is a proprietary implementation of the -- *** JNX *** draft-ietf-idr-bgp4-mibv2-03.txt MIB as written by -- *** JNX *** the IETF Inter-Domain Routing Working Group. -- *** JNX *** This Juniper experimental MIB will be retired when a -- *** JNX *** valid oid branch is assigned.
draft-ietf-idr-bgp4-mibv2-03.txt version written by -- *** JNX *** the IETF Inter-Domain Routing Working Group.

jnxBgpM2.contactinfo: E-mail: idr@merit.net Jeffrey Haas (Editor) 825 Victors Way, Suite 100 Ann Arbor, MI 48108 Tel: +1 734 222-1600 Fax: +1 734 222-1602 E-mail: jhaas@nexthop.com
jnxBgpM2.description: This MIB module defines management objects for the Border Gateway Protocol, Version 4.

JnxBgpM2Identifier.name: JnxBgpM2Identifier
JnxBgpM2Identifier.description: The representation of a BGP Identifier. The BGP Identifier should be represented in the OCTET STRING as with the first OCTET of the string containing the first OCTET of the BGP Identifier received or sent in the OPEN packet and so on. Even though the BGP Identifier is trending away from an IP address it is still displayed as if it was one, even when it would be an illegal IP address.

JnxBgpM2Safi.name: JnxBgpM2Safi
JnxBgpM2Safi.description: The representation of a BGP Safi

JnxBgpM2Community.name: JnxBgpM2Community
JnxBgpM2Community.description: The representation of a BGP Community.

JnxBgpM2ExtendedCommunity.name: JnxBgpM2ExtendedCommunity
JnxBgpM2ExtendedCommunity.description: The representation of a BGP Extended Community.

jnxBgpM2Established.name: jnxBgpM2Established
jnxBgpM2Established.description: The BGP Established event is generated when the BGP FSM enters the ESTABLISHED state.

jnxBgpM2BackwardTransition.name: jnxBgpM2BackwardTransition
jnxBgpM2BackwardTransition.description: The BGPBackwardTransition Event is generated when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state.

jnxBgpM2VersionEntry.name: jnxBgpM2VersionEntry
jnxBgpM2VersionEntry.description: Entry containing data on a given supported version of the Border Gateway Protocol and the level of support provided. It is expected that any agent implementation supporting this MIB module will report support for Version 4 of the Border Gateway Protocol at the very minimum.

jnxBgpM2VersionIndex.name: jnxBgpM2VersionIndex
jnxBgpM2VersionIndex.description: The version number of the BGP Protocol.

jnxBgpM2VersionSupported.name: jnxBgpM2VersionSupported
jnxBgpM2VersionSupported.description: This value is TRUE if this version of the BGP protocol identified in 'jnxBgpM2VersionIndex' is supported. The absence of a row for a particular jnxBgpM2VersionIndex indicates that that jnxBgpM2VersionIndex protocol version number is not supported.

jnxBgpM2SupportedAuthEntry.name: jnxBgpM2SupportedAuthEntry
jnxBgpM2SupportedAuthEntry.description: Entry containing information whether a given BGP authentication mechanism is supported by this implementation.

jnxBgpM2SupportedAuthValue.name: jnxBgpM2SupportedAuthValue
jnxBgpM2SupportedAuthValue.description: This value is TRUE if a given authentication method is supported by the local implementation.

jnxBgpM2CapabilitySupportAvailable.name: jnxBgpM2CapabilitySupportAvailable
jnxBgpM2CapabilitySupportAvailable.description: This value is TRUE if capability support is available and is enabled.

jnxBgpM2SupportedCapabilitiesEntry.name: jnxBgpM2SupportedCapabilitiesEntry
jnxBgpM2SupportedCapabilitiesEntry.description: Information about supported capabilities indexed by capability number.

jnxBgpM2SupportedCapabilityCode.name: jnxBgpM2SupportedCapabilityCode
jnxBgpM2SupportedCapabilityCode.description: Index of supported capability. The index directly corresponds with the BGP-4 Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

jnxBgpM2SupportedCapability.name: jnxBgpM2SupportedCapability
jnxBgpM2SupportedCapability.description: This value is True if this capability is supported, False otherwise.

jnxBgpM2AsSize.name: jnxBgpM2AsSize
jnxBgpM2AsSize.description: The size of the AS value in this implementation. The semantics of this are determined as per the as-4bytes draft.

jnxBgpM2LocalAs.name: jnxBgpM2LocalAs
jnxBgpM2LocalAs.description: The local autonomous system number. If the jnxBgpM2AsSize is twoOctet, then the range is constrained to be 0-65535.

jnxBgpM2LocalIdentifier.name: jnxBgpM2LocalIdentifier
jnxBgpM2LocalIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of local system. Current practice is trending away from this value being treated as an IP address and more as a generic identifier.

jnxBgpM2RouteReflector.name: jnxBgpM2RouteReflector
jnxBgpM2RouteReflector.description: This value is TRUE if this implementation supports the BGP Route Reflection Extension and is enabled as a route reflector. If the BGP Route Reflection extension is not supported this value must be FALSE.

jnxBgpM2ClusterId.name: jnxBgpM2ClusterId
jnxBgpM2ClusterId.description: The configured Cluster-ID of the BGP Speaker. This will default to the BGP Speaker's JnxBgpM2Identifier if this speaker is functioning as a route reflector and an explicit Cluster-ID has not been configured. A value of 0.0.0.0 will be present if Route Reflection is not enabled.

jnxBgpM2ConfederationRouter.name: jnxBgpM2ConfederationRouter
jnxBgpM2ConfederationRouter.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
jnxBgpM2ConfederationRouter.description: This value is TRUE if this implementation supports the BGP AS Confederations Extension and this router is configured to be in a confederation.

jnxBgpM2ConfederationId.name: jnxBgpM2ConfederationId
jnxBgpM2ConfederationId.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
jnxBgpM2ConfederationId.description: The local Confederation Identification Number. This value will be zero (0) if this BGP Speaker is not a confederation router.

jnxBgpM2CfgBaseScalarStorageType.name: jnxBgpM2CfgBaseScalarStorageType
jnxBgpM2CfgBaseScalarStorageType.description: This object specifies the intended storage type for all configurable base scalars.

jnxBgpM2CfgLocalAs.name: jnxBgpM2CfgLocalAs
jnxBgpM2CfgLocalAs.description: The local autonomous system number. If the jnxBgpM2AsSize is twoOctet, then the range is constrained to be 0-65535.

jnxBgpM2CfgLocalIdentifier.name: jnxBgpM2CfgLocalIdentifier
jnxBgpM2CfgLocalIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of local system. Current practice is trending away from this value being treated as an IP address and more as a generic identifier.

jnxBgpM2CfgRouteReflector.name: jnxBgpM2CfgRouteReflector
jnxBgpM2CfgRouteReflector.description: This value is set to true if this implementation will be supporting route reflection.

jnxBgpM2CfgClusterId.name: jnxBgpM2CfgClusterId
jnxBgpM2CfgClusterId.description: The configured Cluster-ID of the BGP Speaker. This will default to the BGP Speaker's JnxBgpM2Identifier if this speaker is functioning as a route reflector and an explicit Cluster-ID has not been configured. A value of 0.0.0.0 will be present if Route Reflection is not enabled.

jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationRouter.name: jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationRouter
jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationRouter.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationRouter.description: This value is set to true if this implementation will be supporting BGP AS Confederations.

jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationId.name: jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationId
jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationId.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
jnxBgpM2CfgConfederationId.description: The local Confederation Identification Number. This value will be zero (0) if this BGP Speaker is not a confederation router.

jnxBgpM2PeerTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerTable
jnxBgpM2PeerTable.description: BGP peer table. This table contains, one entry per remote BGP peer, any information about the connections with the remote BGP peers.

jnxBgpM2PeerEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerEntry.description: Entry containing information about the connection with a remote BGP peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerIdentifier.name: jnxBgpM2PeerIdentifier
jnxBgpM2PeerIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of this entry's remote BGP peer. This entry should be 0.0.0.0 unless the jnxBgpM2PeerState is in the OpenConfirm or the Established state.

jnxBgpM2PeerState.name: jnxBgpM2PeerState
jnxBgpM2PeerState.description: The remote BGP peer's FSM state.

jnxBgpM2PeerStatus.name: jnxBgpM2PeerStatus
jnxBgpM2PeerStatus.description: Whether or not the BGP FSM for this remote peer is halted or running. The BGP FSM for a remote peer is halted after processing a Stop event. Likewise, it is in the running state after a Start event. The jnxBgpM2PeerState will generally be in the idle state when the FSM is halted, although some extensions such as Graceful Restart will leave the peer in the Idle state but with the FSM running.

jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredVersion.name: jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredVersion
jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredVersion.description: The configured version to originally start with this remote peer. The BGP speaker may permit negotiation to a lower version number of the protocol.

jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedVersion.name: jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedVersion
jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedVersion.description: The negotiated version of BGP running between the two peers.

jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAddrType.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAddrType
jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAddrType.description: The address family of the local end of the peering session.

jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAddr.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAddr
jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAddr.description: The address of the local end of the peering session.

jnxBgpM2PeerLocalPort.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLocalPort
jnxBgpM2PeerLocalPort.description: The local port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers.

jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAs.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAs
jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAs.description: Some implementations of BGP can represent themselves as multiple ASs. This is the AS that this peering session is representing itself as to the remote peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType.name: jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType
jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType.description: The address family of the remote end of the peering session.

jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAddr.name: jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAddr
jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAddr.description: The address of the remote end of the peering session.

jnxBgpM2PeerRemotePort.name: jnxBgpM2PeerRemotePort
jnxBgpM2PeerRemotePort.reference: RFC 2012 - SNMPv2 Management Information Base for the Transmission Control Protocol using SMIv2. RFC 2542 - IP Version 6 Management Information Base for the Transmission Control Protocol.
jnxBgpM2PeerRemotePort.description: The remote port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers. In the case of a transport for which the notion of 'port' is irrelevant, an instance value of -1 should be returned by the agent for this object. Note that the objects jnxBgpM2PeerLocalAddr, jnxBgpM2PeerLocalPort, jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAddr and jnxBgpM2PeerRemotePort provide the appropriate reference to the standard MIB TCP connection table. or even the ipv6 TCP MIB as in rfc2452.

jnxBgpM2PeerIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PeerIndex
jnxBgpM2PeerIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the remote peer entry in the jnxBgpM2PeerTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the jnxBgpM2PeerTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of jnxBgpM2PeerIndex row instance values across rows of the jnxBgpM2PeerTable. It is used to provide an index structure for other tables whose data is logically per-peer. For explicitly configured peers, this value will remain consistent until this row is deleted by deleting the configured peers. Unconfigured peers will generate a monotonically increasing number when a BGP FSM is built to process the peering session. Values in the jnxBgpM2PeerTable and other tables utilizing jnxBgpM2PeerIndex are expected to remain in existence for an arbitrary time after the unconfigured peer has been deleted in order to allow management applications to extract useful management information for those peers. Thus, an unconfigured peer using the same indices as the jnxBgpM2PeerTable that comes up while this row still exists will re-utilize the same row.

jnxBgpM2PeerErrorsTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerErrorsTable
jnxBgpM2PeerErrorsTable.description: On a per peer basis, this table reflects the last protocol-defined error encountered and reported on the peer session. If no entry for a given peer, by its jnxBgpM2PeerIndex, exists in this table, then no such errors have been observed, reported, and recorded on the session.

jnxBgpM2PeerErrorsEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerErrorsEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerErrorsEntry.description: Each entry contains information about errors sent and received for a particular BGP peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived.description: The last error code and subcode received by this BGP Speaker via a NOTIFICATION message for this peer. If no error has occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code, and the second byte contains the subcode.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSent.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSent
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSent.description: The last error code and subcode sent by this BGP Speaker via a NOTIFICATION message to this peer. If no error has occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code, and the second byte contains the subcode.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime.description: The timestamp that the last NOTIFICATION was received from this peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentTime.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentTime
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentTime.description: The timestamp that the last NOTIFICATION was sent to this peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText.description: This object contains an implementation specific explanation of the error that was reported.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentText.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentText
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentText.description: This object contains an implementation specific explanation of the error that is being reported.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedData.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedData
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedData.description: The last error code's data seen by this peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentData.name: jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentData
jnxBgpM2PeerLastErrorSentData.description: The last error code's data sent to this peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthTable
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthTable.description: BGP peer authentication table. This table contains, one entry per BGP peer, information about the authentication with BGP peers.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthEntry.description: Entry containing information about the authentication with a BGP peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSent.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSent
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSent.description: The local peer has sent authentication information to the remote peer in the BGP Authentication field.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSentCode.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSentCode
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSentCode.description: The code of the authentication information sent to the remote peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSentValue.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSentValue
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthSentValue.description: The payload of the authentication information from the remote peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvd.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvd
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvd.description: The local peer has received authentication information from the remote peer in the BGP Authentication field.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvdCode.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvdCode
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvdCode.description: The code of the authentication information received from the remote peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvdValue.name: jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvdValue
jnxBgpM2PeerAuthRcvdValue.description: The payload of the authentication information from the remote peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerEventTimesTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerEventTimesTable
jnxBgpM2PeerEventTimesTable.description: A table reporting the per-peering session amount of time elapsed and update events since the peering session advanced into the Established state.

jnxBgpM2PeerEventTimesEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerEventTimesEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerEventTimesEntry.description: Each row contains a set of statistics about time spent and events encountered in the peer session Established state.

jnxBgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTime.name: jnxBgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTime
jnxBgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTime.description: This timer indicates how long (in seconds) this peer has been in the Established state or how long since this peer was last in the Established state. It is set to zero when a new peer is configured or the router is booted.

jnxBgpM2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime.name: jnxBgpM2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime
jnxBgpM2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime.description: Elapsed time in seconds since the last BGP UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time jnxBgpM2PeerInUpdates is incremented, the value of this object is set to zero (0). This value shall also be zero (0) when the peer is not in the Established state

jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable
jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable.description: Per peer management data on BGP session timers.

jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry.description: Each entry corresponds to the current state of BGP timers on a given peering session.

jnxBgpM2PeerConnectRetryInterval.name: jnxBgpM2PeerConnectRetryInterval
jnxBgpM2PeerConnectRetryInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the ConnectRetry timer. The suggested value for this timer is 120 seconds.

jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured.name: jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured
jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the Hold Time configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. This value is placed in an OPEN message sent to this peer by this BGP speaker, and is compared with the Hold Time field in an OPEN message received from the peer when determining the Hold Time (jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTime) with the peer. This value must not be less than three seconds if it is not zero (0) in which case the Hold Time is NOT to be established with the peer. The suggested value for this timer is 90 seconds.

jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured.name: jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured
jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the KeepAlive timer configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. The value of this object will only determine the KEEPALIVE messages frequency relative to the value specified in jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured; the actual time interval for the KEEPALIVE messages is indicated by jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAlive. A reasonable maximum value for this timer would be configured to be one third of that of jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), no periodical KEEPALIVE messages are sent to the peer after the BGP connection has been established. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

jnxBgpM2PeerMinASOrigInterval.name: jnxBgpM2PeerMinASOrigInterval
jnxBgpM2PeerMinASOrigInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinASOriginationInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 15 seconds.

jnxBgpM2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval.name: jnxBgpM2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval
jnxBgpM2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable
jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable.description: Current values of per-peer timers which can be dynamically set in the jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable. Values reflected in this table are the current operational values, after negotiation from values derived from initial configuration or last set from jnxBgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable row instances.

jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.description: Each entry reflects a value of the currently operational, negotiated timers as reflected in the JnxBgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.

jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTime.name: jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTime
jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTime.description: The value of this object is calculated by this BGP Speaker as being; zero (0) - if this was the value sent by the peer and this value is permitted by this BGP Speaker. In this case, no keepalive messages are sent and the Hold Timer is not set. At least three (3). This value is the smaller of the value sent by this peer in the OPEN message and jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured for this peer. This value is only defined when the peering session is in the Established state.

jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAlive.name: jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAlive
jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAlive.description: Time interval in seconds for the KeepAlive timer established with the peer. The value of this object is calculated by this BGP speaker such that, when compared with jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTime, it has the same proportion as what jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured has when compared with jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), it indicates that the KeepAlive timer has not been established with the peer, or, the value of jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured is zero (0). This value is only defined when the peering session is in the Established state.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedTable
jnxBgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedTable.description: This table contains the capabilities that are supported for a given peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedEntry.description: These entries are keyed by a BGP-4 peer remote address and the BGP Capability Code

jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedCode.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedCode
jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedCode.description: The BGP Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedIndex
jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedIndex.description: Multiple instances of a given capability may be sent bgp a BGP speaker. This variable is used to index them.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedValue.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedValue
jnxBgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedValue.description: The value of the announced capability.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapsReceivedTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapsReceivedTable
jnxBgpM2PeerCapsReceivedTable.description: This table contains the capabilities that are supported for a given peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapsReceivedEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapsReceivedEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerCapsReceivedEntry.description: These entries are keyed by a BGP-4 peer remote address and the BGP Capability Code

jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedCode.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedCode
jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedCode.description: The BGP Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedIndex
jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedIndex.description: Multiple instances of a given capability may be sent bgp a BGP speaker. This variable is used to index them.

jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedValue.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedValue
jnxBgpM2PeerCapReceivedValue.description: The value of the announced capability.

jnxBgpM2PeerCountersTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCountersTable
jnxBgpM2PeerCountersTable.description: The counters associated with a BGP Peer.

jnxBgpM2PeerCountersEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerCountersEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerCountersEntry.description: Each entry contains counters of message transmissions and FSM transitions for a given BGP Peering session.

jnxBgpM2PeerInUpdates.name: jnxBgpM2PeerInUpdates
jnxBgpM2PeerInUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages received on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero (0) when the connection is established.

jnxBgpM2PeerOutUpdates.name: jnxBgpM2PeerOutUpdates
jnxBgpM2PeerOutUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages transmitted on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero (0) when the connection is established.

jnxBgpM2PeerInTotalMessages.name: jnxBgpM2PeerInTotalMessages
jnxBgpM2PeerInTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages received from the remote peer on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

jnxBgpM2PeerOutTotalMessages.name: jnxBgpM2PeerOutTotalMessages
jnxBgpM2PeerOutTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages transmitted to the remote peer on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

jnxBgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTrans.name: jnxBgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTrans
jnxBgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTrans.description: The total number of times the BGP FSM transitioned into the established state for this peer.

jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersTable.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersTable
jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersTable.description: Additional per-peer, per AFI SAFI counters for prefixes

jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersEntry
jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersEntry.description: Entry containing information about a bgp-peers prefix counters.

jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersAfi.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersAfi
jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersAfi.description: The AFI index of the per-peer, per prefix counters

jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersSafi.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersSafi
jnxBgpM2PrefixCountersSafi.description: The SAFI index of the per-peer, per prefix counters

jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixes.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixes
jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixes.description: The number of prefixes received from a peer and are stored in the Adj-Ribs-In for that peer.

jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted
jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in the Adj-Ribs-In and are eligible to become active in the Loc-Rib.

jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesRejected.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesRejected
jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesRejected.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in the Adj-Ribs-In and are NOT eligible to become active in the Loc-Rib.

jnxBgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes
jnxBgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in that peers Adj-Ribs-Out.

jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesActive.name: jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesActive
jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesActive.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in the Adj-Ribs-In and are the active route in the Loc-Rib.

jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClientTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClientTable
jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClientTable.description: Table of route reflection client settings on a per-peer basis.

jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClientEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClientEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClientEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a route reflector client.

jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClient.name: jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClient
jnxBgpM2PeerReflectorClient.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is a reflector client of this router, or not. A value of nonClient indicates that this peer is not a reflector client. A value of client indicates that this peer is a reflector client that is not fully meshed with other reflector clients. A value of meshedClient indicates that the peer is a reflector client and is fully meshed with all other reflector clients. This value must be nonClient (0) for BGP external peers.

jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMemberTable.name: jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMemberTable
jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMemberTable.description: Table of confederation member settings on a per-peer basis.

jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMemberEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMemberEntry
jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMemberEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a BGP confederation member.

jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMember.name: jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMember
jnxBgpM2PeerConfedMember.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is in our confederation or not.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusTable.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusTable
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusTable.description: Table containing rows for administratively starting and stopping peering sessions.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusEntry.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusEntry
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusEntry.description: Entry containing row for administratively starting and stopping peers.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatus.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatus
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatus.description: This object allows the Manual Stop and Manual Start events to be sent to an activated peering session.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex.description: This object contains the next appropriate value to use as an index for creation of a row instance in in the jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTable. If the number of available entries in the jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTable is exhausted, a retrieval value of this object instance will return 0. A value of 0 may also be returned if the agent is otherwise incapable of jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTable row creation at the time of jnxBgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex retrieval.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTable.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTable
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTable.description: BGP configuration peer table. This table allows the configuration of the parameters for a session with a BGP peer. +++wayne provide description of how config should be done for a peer per table.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerEntry.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerEntry
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerEntry.description: Entry containing information set up by a management entity to configure a connection with a BGP peer.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion.description: The configured version to originally start with this peer. The BGP speaker may permit negotiation to a lower version number of the protocol depending on the set value of jnxBgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation.

jnxBgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation.name: jnxBgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation
jnxBgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation.description: If set to true, during session establishment with this peer, negotiation to a version lower than that specified in jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion will be allowed.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType.description: The address family of the speakers of this BGP session.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr.description: The address of the local end of the peering session.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAs.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAs
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAs.description: Autonomous system represented to peer on peering session initialization. Some implementations of BGP can represent themselves as multiple ASes. These implementations can set this to an alternate autonomous system. If this object is set to zero (0) at the point this row instance is set to active, then the implementation will initialize this session representing itself as the value of jnxBgpM2CfgLocalAs.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddrType.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddrType
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddrType.description: The address family of the speakers of the remote BGP session.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr.description: The address of the remote end (destination address of peer) for peering session.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemotePort.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemotePort
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemotePort.description: This is the remote port for the transport connection between the BGP peers. In the case of a transport for which the notion of port is irrelevant, the value of -1 can be defaulted or set.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAs.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAs
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAs.description: Autonomous system number of the remote peer.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerEntryStorageType.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerEntryStorageType
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerEntryStorageType.description: This object type specifies the intended storage type for the jnxBgpM2CfgPeerEntry row instance.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerError.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerError
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerError.description: This value indicates the current error status of the row denoting the configured error status. If this row is still under creation (has not been activated jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus), then this instance will be set to not-activated (1). At the point that the row is activated, jnxBgpM2CfgPeerError will reflect the error status of the row data itself. If there is another session already activated with the same local and remote addresses as denoted by {jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType, jnxBgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr, jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr, jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRemotePort}, then the value of this will be set to err-duplicate-peering-session (2). If this row is associated with a peer session whose initialization has been attempted, the value will be set to activated (3) (and, jnxBgpM2PeerCfgPeerEntry will be set to the row instance of the entry in the jnxBgpM2PeerTable which reflects the state of the peering session). Note that this object only reflects the error as a function of the attempted activation of this row as containing data for a bgp peering session. The actual state of the session at the point of any protocol exchange or session state machine initiation is reflected in the jnxBgpM2PeerTable row instance (as reflected through jnxBgpM2CfgPeerPeerEntry) associated with this row instance.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerBgpPeerEntry.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerBgpPeerEntry
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerBgpPeerEntry.description: Upon activation of the session data contained in this row instance, this object points to an instance of a row within the jnxBgpM2PeerTable reflecting the session in its initializing or operational state. Retrieval of this column instance will always yield a value of {0.0} unless the session has successfully been activated (via jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus). Such row instances will always have a value of jnxBgpM2CfgPeerError which is activated (3).

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus.description: This object type is used to control creation, activation, and deletion of this row instance.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerIndex.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerIndex
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerIndex.description: Uniquely identifies an instance of a peer row, as an element of configuration.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerStatus.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerStatus
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerStatus.description: This specifies the state of the peering session upon activation. If disabled, the FSM is in the halted state and no Automatic Start events are generated. If enabled, the FSM is in the running state and Automatic Start events may be generated.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthTable.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthTable
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthTable.description: Table contain per peer configuration for BGP Authentication.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthEntry.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthEntry
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthEntry.description: Entry containing information about a peer's BGP Authentication configuration.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthEnabled.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthEnabled
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthEnabled.description: This value is true if BGP Authentication is enabled for this peer. This is the authentication mechanism documented in the base BGP specification, not the MD5 session protection mechanism.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthCode.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthCode
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthCode.description: The authentication code for the BGP Authentication mechanism.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthValue.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthValue
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerAuthValue.description: The authentication payload for the BGP authentication mechanism. This value has semantic meaning within the context of the authentication code.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTimersTable.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTimersTable
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerTimersTable.description: Table for configuration of per-peer timers.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConnectRetryInterval.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConnectRetryInterval
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConnectRetryInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the ConnectRetry timer. The suggested value for this timer is 120 seconds.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerHoldTimeConfigured.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerHoldTimeConfigured
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerHoldTimeConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the Hold Time configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. This value is placed in an OPEN message sent to this peer by this BGP speaker, and is compared with the Hold Time field in an OPEN message received from the peer when determining the Hold Time (jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTime) with the peer. This value must not be less than three seconds if it is not zero (0) in which case the Hold Time is NOT to be established with the peer. The suggested value for this timer is 90 seconds.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerKeepAliveConfigured.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerKeepAliveConfigured
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerKeepAliveConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the KeepAlive timer configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. The value of this object will only determine the KEEPALIVE messages frequency relative to the value specified in jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured; the actual time interval for the KEEPALIVE messages is indicated by jnxBgpM2PeerKeepAlive. A reasonable maximum value for this timer would be configured to be one third of that of jnxBgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), no periodical KEEPALIVE messages are sent to the peer after the BGP connection has been established. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerMinASOrigInterval.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerMinASOrigInterval
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerMinASOrigInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinASOriginationInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 15 seconds.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerMinRouteAdverInter.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerMinRouteAdverInter
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerMinRouteAdverInter.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientTable.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientTable
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientTable.description: Table of route reflection client settings on a per-peer basis.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientEntry.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientEntry
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a route reflector client.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClient.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClient
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClient.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is a reflector client of this router, or not. A value of nonClient indicates that this peer is not a reflector client. A value of client indicates that this peer is a reflector client that is not fully meshed with other reflector clients. A value of meshedClient indicates that the peer is a reflector client and is fully meshed with all other reflector clients. This value must be nonClient (0) for BGP external peers.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberTable.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberTable
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberTable.description: Table of confederation member settings on a per-peer basis.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberEntry.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberEntry
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a BGP confederation member.

jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMember.name: jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMember
jnxBgpM2CfgPeerConfedMember.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is in our confederation or not.

jnxBgpM2NlriTable.name: jnxBgpM2NlriTable
jnxBgpM2NlriTable.description: The BGP-4 Received Path Attribute Table contains information about paths to destination networks received from all BGP4 peers. Collectively, this represents the Adj-Ribs-In. The route where jnxBgpM2NlriBest is TRUE represents, for this NLRI, the route that is installed in the LocRib from the Adj-Ribs-In.

jnxBgpM2NlriEntry.name: jnxBgpM2NlriEntry
jnxBgpM2NlriEntry.description: Information about a path to a network.

jnxBgpM2NlriIndex.name: jnxBgpM2NlriIndex
jnxBgpM2NlriIndex.reference: RFC 3107 - Carrying Label Information in BGP-4
jnxBgpM2NlriIndex.description: This index allows for multiple instances of a base prefix for a certain AFI SAFI from a given peer. This is currently useful for two things: 1. Allowing for a peer in future implementations to send more than a single route instance. 2. Allow for extensions which extend the NLRI field to send the same prefix while utilizing other extension specific information. An example of this is RFC 3107 - Carrying MPLS labels in BGP.

jnxBgpM2NlriAfi.name: jnxBgpM2NlriAfi
jnxBgpM2NlriAfi.description: The address family of the prefix for this NLRI.

jnxBgpM2NlriSafi.name: jnxBgpM2NlriSafi
jnxBgpM2NlriSafi.description: The subsequent address family of the prefix for this NLRI

jnxBgpM2NlriPrefix.name: jnxBgpM2NlriPrefix
jnxBgpM2NlriPrefix.description: An IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field. This object is an IP address containing the prefix with length specified by jnxBgpM2PathAttrAddrPrefixLen. Any bits beyond the length specified by jnxBgpM2PathAttrAddrPrefixLen are zeroed.

jnxBgpM2NlriPrefixLen.name: jnxBgpM2NlriPrefixLen
jnxBgpM2NlriPrefixLen.description: Length in bits of the address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field.

jnxBgpM2NlriBest.name: jnxBgpM2NlriBest
jnxBgpM2NlriBest.description: An indication of whether or not this route was chosen as the best BGP4 route.

jnxBgpM2NlriCalcLocalPref.name: jnxBgpM2NlriCalcLocalPref
jnxBgpM2NlriCalcLocalPref.description: The degree of preference calculated by the receiving BGP4 speaker for an advertised route.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex
jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the per-NLRI entry in the jnxBgpM2PeerAttrTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the jnxBgpM2PeerAttrTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of jnxBgpM2PeerAttrIndex row instance values across rows of the jnxBgpM2PeerAttrTable. It is used to provide an index structure for other tables whose data is logically per-peer, per-NLRI.

jnxBgpM2NlriOpaqueType.name: jnxBgpM2NlriOpaqueType
jnxBgpM2NlriOpaqueType.reference: RFC 3107 - Carrying Label Information in BGP-4 draft-ietf-mpls-lsr-mib-08.txt
jnxBgpM2NlriOpaqueType.description: This object enumerates the type of the row that is pointed to in the table row jnxBgpM2NlriOpaquePointer instance, if jnxBgpM2NlriOpaquePointer is in fact not a zero length. jnxBgpM2NlriOpaqueType is necessary since the data referenced by jnxBgpM2NlriOpaquePointer is opaque to BGP. For example, in the case of RFC 3107, the label stack that is pointed to may occur in the mplsLabelStackTable from the MPLS-LSR-MIB, and the instance value of jnxBgpM2NlriOpaqueType would be bgpMplsLabelStack(1).

jnxBgpM2NlriOpaquePointer.name: jnxBgpM2NlriOpaquePointer
jnxBgpM2NlriOpaquePointer.description: Pointer to a row that decomposes the data that is opaque to the BGP MIB but is sent in the NLRI. This RowPointer has zero (0) length data instance if jnxBgpM2NlriOpaqueType is none.

jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutTable.name: jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutTable
jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutTable.description: This table contains on a per-peer basis one or more routes from the jnxBgpM2NlriTable that have been placed in this peer's Adj-Ribs-Out.

jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutEntry.name: jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutEntry
jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutEntry.description: List of BGP routes that have been placed into a peer's Adj-Ribs-Out.

jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutIndex.name: jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutIndex
jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutIndex.description: Certain extensions to BGP permit multiple instance of a per afi, per safi prefix to be advertised to a peer. This object allows the enumeration of them.

jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutRoute.name: jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutRoute
jnxBgpM2AdjRibsOutRoute.description: This object points to the route in the jnxBgpM2NlriTable that corresponds to the entry in the peer's Adj-Rib-Out. Outgoing route maps are not reflected at this point as those are part of the Update-Send process.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrCount.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrCount
jnxBgpM2PathAttrCount.description: The number of entries in the jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable
jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable.description: Provides per advertised network-prefix attribute data, as advertised over a peering session.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrEntry
jnxBgpM2PathAttrEntry.description: Each entry contains data about a given network prefix, per-prefix and per-advertising peer.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrOrigin.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrOrigin
jnxBgpM2PathAttrOrigin.description: The ultimate origin of the path information.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrNextHopAddrType.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrNextHopAddrType
jnxBgpM2PathAttrNextHopAddrType.description: The address family of the address for the border router that should be used to access the destination network.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrNextHop.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrNextHop
jnxBgpM2PathAttrNextHop.description: The address of the border router that should be used to access the destination network. This address is the nexthop address received in the UPDATE packet. The address family of this object will be the same as that of the prefix in this row. Note that for RFC2545 style double nexthops, this object will always contain the global scope nexthop. jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable will contain the linklocal scope nexthop. In the case that the mechanism documented in draft-kato-bgp-ipv6-link-local-00.txt is used and only a link local nexthop has been sent, , jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent will be false and jnxBgpM2PathAttrNextHop will contain the link local nexthop.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrMedPresent.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrMedPresent
jnxBgpM2PathAttrMedPresent.description: Whether or not the MED value is present. If it is not present, the jnxBgpM2PathAttrMed object has no useful value and should be set to 0.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrMed.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrMed
jnxBgpM2PathAttrMed.description: This metric is used to discriminate between multiple exit points to an adjacent autonomous system.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrLocalPrefPresent.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrLocalPrefPresent
jnxBgpM2PathAttrLocalPrefPresent.description: Whether or not the LocalPref value is present. If it is not present, the jnxBgpM2PathAttrLocalPref object has no useful value and should be set to 0.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrLocalPref.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrLocalPref
jnxBgpM2PathAttrLocalPref.description: The originating BGP4 speakers degree of preference for an advertised route.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrAtomicAggregate.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrAtomicAggregate
jnxBgpM2PathAttrAtomicAggregate.description: When this object is set to atomicAggregatePresent, the ATOMIC_AGGREGATE Path Attribute is present and indicates that the NLRI MUST NOT be made more specific.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS
jnxBgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS.description: The AS number of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of zero (0) indicates the absence of this attribute. Note propagation of AS of zero is illegal in the Internet.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAddr.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAddr
jnxBgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAddr.description: The IP address of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates the absence of this attribute.

jnxBgpM2AsPathCalcLength.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathCalcLength
jnxBgpM2AsPathCalcLength.description: This value represents the calculated length of the AS Path according to the rules of the BGP specification. This value is used in route selection.

jnxBgpM2AsPathString.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathString
jnxBgpM2AsPathString.description: This is a string depicting the autonomous system path to this network which was received from the peer which advertised it. The format of the string is implementation-dependent, and should be designed for operator readability.

jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex
jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the decomposed AS Path in the jnxBgpM2AsPathTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the jnxBgpM2AsPathTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex row instance values across rows of the jnxBgpM2AsPathTable.

jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteTable.name: jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteTable
jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteTable.reference: draft-ietf-idr-as4bytes-04.txt - BGP support for four-octet AS number space
jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteTable.description: This table is present for BGP speakers that support the AS 4byte specification and are functioning as a router between 2-byte and 4-byte AS space.

jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteEntry.name: jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteEntry
jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteEntry.description: Each row contains the information for the AS 4-byte extension's NEW_AS_PATH and NEW_AGGREGATOR attributes.

jnxBgpM2AsPath4bytePathPresent.name: jnxBgpM2AsPath4bytePathPresent
jnxBgpM2AsPath4bytePathPresent.description: This value may only be true if this BGP Speaker is functioning as a router between ASs that are in 2-byte and 4-byte AS space. If this value is true, then the NEW_AS_PATH attributes are present and the 4-byte versions of the appropriate path attributes are in this row. If this value is false, then the following values will be present in the row: jnxBgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS - zero (0). jnxBgpM2AsPathCalcLength - zero (0). jnxBgpM2AsPathString - zero (0) length string. jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex - zero (0).

jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteAggregatorAS.name: jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteAggregatorAS
jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteAggregatorAS.description: The NEW_AGGREGATOR AS number of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of zero (0) indicates the absence of this attribute. Note propagation of AS of zero is illegal in the Internet.

jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteCalcLength.name: jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteCalcLength
jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteCalcLength.description: This value represents the calculated length of the NEW_AS_PATH according to the rules of the BGP specification. This value is used in route selection.

jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteString.name: jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteString
jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteString.description: This is a string depicting the autonomous system path to this network which was received from the peer which advertised it. The format of the string is implementation-dependent, and should be designed for operator readability.

jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteIndex.name: jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteIndex
jnxBgpM2AsPath4byteIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the decomposed AS Path in the jnxBgpM2AsPathTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the jnxBgpM2AsPathTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex row instance values across rows of the jnxBgpM2AsPathTable.

jnxBgpM2AsPathTable.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathTable
jnxBgpM2AsPathTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute AS Path Table contains the per network path (NLRI) AS PATH data received from the advertising BGP peer.

jnxBgpM2AsPathEntry.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathEntry
jnxBgpM2AsPathEntry.description: Information about an AS path provided with a path to a network.

jnxBgpM2AsPathSegmentIndex.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathSegmentIndex
jnxBgpM2AsPathSegmentIndex.description: A per-AS path segment index. This will index a set of autonomous systems in an AS path which are part of the same sequence or set (as determined by the row value of jnxBgpM2AsPathType, which should be the same value for each jnxBgpM2AsPathTable entry indexed by the same (jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex, jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex) pair).

jnxBgpM2AsPathElementIndex.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathElementIndex
jnxBgpM2AsPathElementIndex.description: A per-AS element index. This will index a particular AS within a sequence or set of autonomous systems in an AS path.

jnxBgpM2AsPathType.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathType
jnxBgpM2AsPathType.description: The type of sequence in which this asPath was advertised as an attribute. Note that all asPath row instances for a given (jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex, jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex) index pair will have their jnxBgpM2AsPathType set to the same value. The values for jnxBgpM2AsPathType are interpreted as defined in the base BGP document and the BGP AS Confederations document.

jnxBgpM2AsPathElementValue.name: jnxBgpM2AsPathElementValue
jnxBgpM2AsPathElementValue.description: An AS value for an AS the related NLRI traversed in the propagation of its advertisement. This value is to be interpreted in the context of the sequence implied by jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex and jnxBgpM2AsPathType (and, in sequence of the other table rows with the same value of jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex and jnxBgpM2AsPathIndex).

jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownTable.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownTable
jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Unknown Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the path attributes advertised with a route but not known to the local BGP implementation or not otherwise capable of being returned from this agent. The absence of row data for a given index value for jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of such unknown attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable).

jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownEntry
jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownEntry.description: Information about an unknown attribute provided with a path to a network.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownIndex
jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownIndex.description: An integer index for a row in this table.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownType.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownType
jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownType.description: The attribute type advertised with this unknown attribute by the peer.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownValue.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownValue
jnxBgpM2PathAttrUnknownValue.description: Value of path attribute not understood by the base BGP-4 document. Octets beyond the maximum size, if any, are not recorded by this row object.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdTable.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdTable
jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdTable.description: Per prefix data pertinent to advertisement of a network prefix through an originator.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdEntry
jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdEntry.description: Each entry contains data pertinent to a network prefix as received through its originating BGP route reflector.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorId.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorId
jnxBgpM2PathAttrOriginatorId.description: The Originator-ID identifying the router that initially advertised this destination to a Route Reflector. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates the absence of this attribute.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterTable.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterTable
jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Cluster Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the reflection path which a route has traversed. The absence of row data for a given index value for jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of this attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable).

jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterEntry
jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterEntry.description: Information about a cluster traversal provided with a path to a network.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex
jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex.description: An integral index for a row in this table.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterValue.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterValue
jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterValue.description: A four octet long value representing a part of the reflection path that the route has passed. Each such four octet long value represents the ID of a cluster that the route has traversed. The sequence of this path as received in the route advertisement will be preserved in the sequence of jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterTable rows (and the jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterValues in each row) as returned for a given jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex value, and the monotonically increasing sequence of jnxBgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex values for that jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommTable.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommTable
jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Community Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the community membership advertised with a route. The absence of row data for a given index value for jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of this attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable).

jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommEntry
jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommEntry.description: Information about a community association provided with a path to a network.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommIndex
jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommIndex.description: An integer index for a row in this table.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommValue.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommValue
jnxBgpM2PathAttrCommValue.description: A value representing a community. There are certain 4-octet long values which could be returned in this columnar row data that carry additional semantics.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommTable.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommTable
jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Community Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the extended community membership advertised with a route. The absence of row data for a given index value for jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of this attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that jnxBgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the jnxBgpM2PathAttrTable). XXX JMH - can not assign the OID until an RFC is published.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommEntry.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommEntry
jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommEntry.description: Information about an extended community association provided with a path to a network.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommIndex.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommIndex
jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommIndex.description: An integral index for a row in this table.

jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommValue.name: jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommValue
jnxBgpM2PathAttrExtCommValue.description: A value representing an extended community which was received with the route implied by the jnxBgpM2PathAttr Index value of this row data. There are certain 8-octet long values which could be returned in this columnar row data that carry additional semantics.

jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable.name: jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable
jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable.reference: RFC 2545 - Use of BGP-4 Multiprotocol Extensions for IPv6 Inter-Domain Routing
jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable.description: Table of link local nexthops as sent by RFC 2545 for IPv6 BGP Speakers.

jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopEntry.name: jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopEntry
jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopEntry.description: Entry containing the link-local nexthops as sent by a BGP speaker running RFC 2545 extensions for double-nexthops.

jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent.name: jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent
jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent.description: This value is TRUE if and only if the BGP speaker is receiving IPv6 NLRI using the RFC 2545 double nexthop convention and it has received a link local scope nexthop in addition to the global scope nexthop.

jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHop.name: jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHop
jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHop.description: This value contains an IPv6 link local address of InetAddressType of type ipv6z. This value is only present if jnxBgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent is true.
